metadata.Title: CVE-2021-35039 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.Description:
kernel/module.c in the Linux kernel before 5.12.14 mishandles SignatureVerification, aka CID-0c18f29aae7c. Without CONFIG_MODULE_SIG, verificationthat a kernel module is signed, for loading via init_module, does not occurfor a module.sig_enforce=1 command-line argument.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-35039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.15.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-25.25').
linux-kvm package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1004.4').
linux-ibm package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.2').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-24.24').
